problem_text:
Is it true that, in a group of the form G = AB, every subgroup N of A ∩ B which is subnormal both in A and in B is subnormal in G? The answer is affirmative in the case of finite groups (H. Wielandt).
Ya. P. Sysak
answer: No, not always (C. Casolo, U. Dardano, J. Group Theory, 7 (2004), 507–520).
